title: Heavy lags, but good ms
body:
Hi everyone,
I've been experiencing some really weird lags lately (about 1-3 weeks).
My MS looks fine [about 110 ms] (I must say it's a little higher then it was before [about 90 ms].
My fps also looks fine [about 40-170].
When I play, I suffer from lags when my fps is still fine. Sometimes it shoes me the "attempting to reconnect" sign that we all love, and sometimes my champion just stays in the movement order i gave him (keeps walking in the same direction or stays in the place) while all the rest of the game keeps moving (but in a laggy way..). I can still see the dmg signs and stuff like that (again, in a laggy way), and can't control my champion.

My Laptop:
Windows 10
16GB Ram
Intel Core i7-4500U 1.80GHz-2.40GHz
I think it's enough.

I always had a better experience of LoL, and it just started happening lately (about 1-3 weeks ago).
I don't have network issues in other programs\websites.
I live in Israel.

I Tried some things that didn't help me:
Changed my internet supplier
Checked my internet foundations
Got a new, better router (my previous one was really bad tho) (of course, i forwarded the LoL ports right after I got it)
Played from my iPhone's personal spot (i used to do this before the problem and it's pretty playable, as long as you don't get a message or a call mid-game)
Checked that there is no other programs that are using my internet during gameplay
Changed my video setting to the lowest settings possible
Disabled movement prediction

As I said, none of these helped.

Anyone has a solution or an idea where this problem comes from?

Thanks!

replies.body: Your higher ping and outright disconnection sounds like your network is having some major issues reaching the game server.  I know you've tried some steps already, but I suspect that there might be a more local issue causing these disconnects.  My suggestion would be to additionally go over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide.  This will help troubleshoot as well as rule pout possibilities.  Test it in a custom game, and let me know how it goes.
